item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã755 ‚Äî October 3, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The State of JavaScript 2025 Survey ‚Äî Each year, Devographics runs an epic survey of as many JavaScript community members as it can and turns the results into an interesting report on the state of the ecosystem ‚Äì here‚Äôs the results from 2024. If you have the time, fill it in, especially as they format it in a way where you can actually learn about stuff as you¬†go.

Devographics

React 19.2 Released ‚Äî The third release in a year for React, this time introducing new features like <Activity /> (a way to hide and restore the UI and internal state of its children), useEffectEvent, and improvements to Chrome DevTools' performance profiles so you can see more about React‚Äôs scheduling and the tree of components it‚Äôs working with. Oh, and how about partial¬†pre-rendering?

The React Team

Don‚Äôt miss The AI Security Developers Challenge at DevSecCon on Oct 22, 2025 ‚Äî Participate in the hands-on developer challenge workshop üíªat DevSecCon and get a chance to team up with industry experts from around the globe üåé. Register for free and walk away with practical tips you can apply directly to your projects¬†üöÄ.

Snyk sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • Monthly roundups aplenty from the Svelte project, team Astro, and Viteland!

  • It was recently discovered that Electron-based apps were causing system-wide lag on macOS 26/Tahoe due to changes in a private API. Electron 38.2, 37.6 and 36.9.2 fix the bug.

  • üì∫ The creators of popular documentaries ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†about Vue.js, ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†React, and ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†Node.js are about to release a new one about Vite. It lands next week; ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†here's a 1-minute teaser trailer.

  • The newly relaunched JSConf event returns to Maryland on October 14-16. Tickets are still available and they gave us a JSCONF25NEWSLETTER code which gives a discount. (Note: We have no financial relationship with the event.)

  • ü§ñ Google AI Studio has added the ability to generate Angular apps.

  • The release of Bun 1.3, expected yesterday, has been pushed back to next¬†Monday.

RELEASES:

  • Anime.js 4.2 ‚Äì Powerful JavaScript animation¬†engine.

  • npm-check-updates 19.0 ‚Äì Find newer versions of packages dependencies than your package.json¬†allows.

  • pnpm 10.18, Oxlint 1.19, Bun 1.2.23, Deno 2.5.3

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

How Deno Protects Against npm Exploits ‚Äî The maintainers of the Deno runtime reflect on the recent npm ecosystem security issues and show off how Deno‚Äôs non-permissive explicit ‚Äòsecure by default‚Äô model can¬†help.

Andy Jiang

Cleaning House in Nx Monorepo: How I Removed 120 Unused Deps Safely ‚Äî Another win (mostly) for Knip, a tool that helps you declutter projects by finding unused¬†dependencies.

John James

Tests Are Dead. Meticulous Is Here ‚Äî Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer¬†effort.

Meticulous sponsor

You Can Now Make PS2 Games in JavaScript ‚Äî Last week we mentioned running JavaScript in MS-DOS but you can take it to Sony‚Äôs Playstation 2 as well using a system built upon QuickJS.

JSLegendDev

How to Detect Safari and iOS Versions from JavaScript ‚Äî Naturally, progressive enhancement is the best policy, but if you need¬†to..

Evgeniy Valyaev

Mastering npx: A Cheatsheet for npm and Node Power Users ‚Äî You‚Äôve almost certainly used the npx command to easily run a command from an npm package (either local or remote) ‚Äì it‚Äôs easy to use, but npx has a couple of other features and options to keep in¬†mind.

Liran Tal

üìÑ Why Next.js Falls Short on Software Engineering Harshal Patil

üìÑ @ts-ignore is Almost Always the Worst Option ‚Äì Prefer any and @ts-expect-error, says the¬†author. Evan Hahn

üìÑ I Want to Intercept Boolean Coercion for Objects in JavaScript Zach Leatherman

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

qjs: Run JavaScript in Go using QuickJS and Wazero ‚Äî A new Cgo-free JavaScript runtime option for integrating JavaScript into apps written in Go. It uses a fork of QuickJS that‚Äôs compiled to WebAssembly and then run using¬†Wazero.

Nguyen Ngoc Phuong and Contributors

üí° If you happen to be a Go developer, we have a sister newsletter for that!

Diagramming Library for the Enterprise? Use JointJS ‚Äî Cut dev time 12x with JointJS, the most feature-rich diagramming library trusted by Fortune 100¬†companies.

JointJS sponsor

SpaceTime 7.11: A Lightweight Timezone Library ‚Äî Use this to calculate times in other timezones. Has a Moment-like API but is immutable. No dependencies. GitHub¬†repo.

Spencer Kelly

Jeasx: A Lightweight SSR Framework That Uses JSX ‚Äî A server side rendering framework built on top of JSX and Fastify. It doesn‚Äôt use React, but if you want to keep using JSX while keeping your server side lightweight, it‚Äôs an option. The JSX functionality is provided by the author‚Äôs jsx-async-runtime package. v1.9 was just¬†released.

Maik Jablonski

üìä¬†Vue ECharts 8.0: Vue.js Component for Apache ECharts ‚Äî Apache ECharts is a popular, powerful JavaScript charting library we‚Äôve linked many times and this project makes it easier to use in Vue.js apps. v8.0 upgrades to ECharts 6.0. GitHub¬†repo.

GU Yiling and ECOMFE

modern-tar: Zero-Dependency Streaming tar Parser and Writer ‚Äî As in the classic tar archive¬†format.

Ayuhito

  • üóìÔ∏è Color Calendar 2.0 ‚Äì Add interactive events calendars to a¬†page.

  • Skia Canvas 3.0 ‚Äì GPU-powered 2D vector canvas graphics for¬†Node.

  • CKEditor5 47.0 ‚Äì Popular commercial rich text editor¬†framework.

  • Verdaccio 6.2 ‚Äì Lightweight local private npm¬†registry.

  • BlockNote 0.40 ‚Äì 'Notion-style' block-based¬†editor.

  • NodeBB 4.6 ‚Äì Node.js based forum¬†system.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üöÄ FastCI: How to double the speed of your Continuous Integration with a 2-minute¬†setup.

At Holepunch we maintain 2000+ OSS npm packages, make the JS runtime Bare to build the P2P Internet. Real tech, Real impact. Join¬†us!

üï∞¬†¬†ICYMI (Some older stuff that may catch your eye...)

üõ£Ô∏è Sean C Davis runs through strategies for managing routes in JavaScript projects ‚Äî good, practical advice for establishing a consistent workflow and improve overall maintainability.

ü¶Ü Remember Duck Hunt for the NES? Well, ‚ñ∂Ô∏è here's a lengthy video looking at how to recreate it in¬†TypeScript.

üõ†Ô∏è Chizaram Ken runs through a handful of reasons why your Next.js app may be slow, along with some possible¬†fixes.

üòó¬†¬†And a weird note to end on..

Have you ever wanted to program by whistling? Now you can. Velato is a JavaScript-inspired esoteric language designed to be written entirely by whistling and you can give it a go in your browser right now. I struggled with it, but you might have more luck (it doesn't seem to like Safari, for¬†starters).

Velato was built by Daniel Temkin, the author of Forty-Four Esolangs, a new book, published by MIT Press, about an artist's take on creating esoteric programming languages.

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã754 ‚Äî September 26, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Give Your AI Eyes: Introducing Chrome DevTools MCP ‚Äî The Chrome team has released an MCP server for Chrome DevTools, enabling agents like Claude Code or OpenAI Codex to use the DevTools to debug and analyze the performance and behavior of your webapps (or even just to automate the use of Chrome generally). Addy does a great job of explaining the potential¬†here.

Addy Osmani

AI Code Reviews Meet CLI Coding Agents ‚Äî CodeRabbit CLI brings instant code reviews directly to your terminal, integrating with Claude Code, Cursor CLI, and other AI agents. While they generate code, CodeRabbit ensures it's production-ready - catching bugs, security issues, and hallucinations before they hit your¬†codebase.

CodeRabbit sponsor

GitHub's Plan for a More Secure npm Supply Chain ‚Äî In direct response to the recent npm ecosystem supply chain attacks of recent weeks, GitHub‚Äôs senior director of security research has outlined steps GitHub is taking, including blocking the upload of packages featuring the patterns of the recent malware, hardening package publication, and promoting the use of trusted¬†publishing.

Xavier Ren√©-Corail (GitHub)

IN BRIEF:

  • Netscape Navigator 2.0 Beta was released 30 years ago ‚Äì it was notable as the first browser to include JavaScript support.

  • The agenda of this week's TC39 meeting where several proposals were advanced, including Import Bytes, Iterator Chunking, and Array.prototype.pushAll.

  • The Chrome team expects Chrome/Chromium's support for the Temporal API to land in Chromium 144 (the current stable version is 140).

  • InfoQ shares an update on the features of Preact 11 beta, the recently released update to the popular lightweight React¬†alternative.

  • The IEEE has released its list of the top programming languages of 2025 with JavaScript and TypeScript coming in at #6 and #7¬†respectively.

RELEASES:

  • pnpm 10.17 ‚Äì The new minimumReleaseAgeExclude now supports patterns to exclude groups of packages from minimum release age¬†checks.

  • Astro 5.14 - Boasts "a bumper harvest of features and DX improvements to warm the cockles of your heart."

  • Node.js v24.9.0 (Current) and v22.20.0 (LTS)

  • Nuxt UI 4.0, PostgreSQL 18.0, ESLint v9.36.0

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

From Steam to Floppy: Porting Modern TypeScript to Run on DOS ‚Äî The creator of a DOS-inspired programming game (available on Steam) wanted to try and get the game running on real DOS. Thanks to jSH, a JavaScript engine for DOS, it was kinda do-able.

Jimbly / Dashing Strike

NPM Security Best Practices ‚Äî An extensive list of best practices, techniques, and ideas to consider for making your use of the npm packaging ecosystem and its tooling more¬†secure.

Boda

Implementing Authentication and Session Management in Next.js ‚Äî Learn how to integrate user sign-up, sign-in, and protected routes into your Next.js app with modern auth¬†practices.

Clerk sponsor

JSON is Not JSON Across Languages ‚Äî If you use JSON to communicate between systems built in different languages, beware. Different libraries with varying opinions can cause ‚Äúsome of the most soul-crushing debugging experiences in software¬†development.‚Äù

Dochia CLI

üìÑ Stop Using .reverse().find(): Meet findLast() Matt Smith

üìÑ Storing Unwise Amounts of Data in JavaScript BigInts Jonathan Frere

üé§ Making Desktop Frameworks More Accessible with Electron ‚Äì A 20 minute chat with a long-time Electron¬†maintainer. The GitHub Podcast

üìÑ Create 'Sick' Web Animations in Three.js with GSAP ‚Äì A very simple¬†example. Michael Li

üìÑ How to Test the New ARIA Notify API with Cypress Mark Noonan

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

ü§ñ¬†GitHub Copilot CLI Now in Public Preview ‚Äî Not content to let Claude Code and OpenAI Codex dominate the CLI-based dev agent scene, GitHub has released a CLI-based version of Copilot, built using¬†Node.

GitHub

TanStack Start v1 Release Candidate ‚Äî TanStack‚Äôs attempt at a full-stack TanStack Router-powered framework has reached a v1.0 release candidate that‚Äôs expected to be largely the same as its eventual 1.0 release. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the next chapter in building type-safe, high-performance React apps without the heavy¬†abstractions.‚Äù

Tanner Linsley

Roles Get Messy Fast. WorkOS RBAC Keeps Access in Check ‚Äî Define roles, group permissions, and sync with SSO and SCIM. Manage access with clean APIs and a powerful¬†dashboard.

WorkOS sponsor

Cap'n Web: A New RPC System for Browsers and Web Servers ‚Äî A ‚Äòspiritual sibling‚Äô to Cap‚Äôn Proto, an RPC protocol created by one of the same authors. However, Cap‚Äôn Web‚Äôs underlying serialization is human-readable, focused on integrating well with JS runtimes, and works over HTTP, WebSocket, and postMessage() out-of-the-box.

Varda and Faulkner (Cloudflare)

eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect ‚Äî What a project name! It‚Äôs an ESLint plugin to help React developers catch unnecessary useEffects which are quite commonly¬†overused.

Nick van Dyke

  • üìä Billboard.js 3.17.0 (above) ‚Äì The popular charting library adds image label support for charts, label border styling, and dynamic control of label colors.

  • PythonMonkey 1.3 ‚Äì Embed the SpiderMonkey JS engine into Python's¬†VM. Now with Python 3.14¬†support.

  • pretty-bytes 7.1 ‚Äì Convert a size in bytes into a human readable¬†equivalent (e.g. 1337 becomes '1.34¬†kB').

  • Docusaurus 3.9 ‚Äì The popular React + MDX-powered content/docs site¬†generator.

  • Neo.mjs 10.9 ‚Äì Multi-threaded framework for fast, desktop-like¬†webapps.

  • eslint-plugin-vue 10.5 ‚Äì Official ESLint plugin for Vue.js.¬†(Homepage.)

  • VanJS 1.6 ‚Äì The small but sweet reactive UI framework.¬†(Homepage.)

  • Milkdown 7.16 ‚Äì Plugin-driven WYSIWYG Markdown editor¬†framework.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

üöÄ Next week: JetBrains JavaScript Day 2025! A free online event full of talks & live Q&A with experts from the JS community. Don‚Äôt miss¬†it!

üßê¬†Learning web development with Dr.¬†Axel

Over the past couple of months the esteemed Dr. Axel Rauschmayer has been working on a valuable series of beginner-friendly posts on a range of web development topics, with a heavy focus on JavaScript. He pitches the series as a way to teach people "who have never programmed how to create web apps with JavaScript".

These are all excellent primers/refreshers, and ideal for sharing with those early in their web development journey. Here are some of the highlights so far:

  • Working with numbers, variables, and functions, and strings and methods.
  • Booleans, comparisons and if statements and loops.
  • Digging into plain objects, Arrays, Maps, and exceptions.
  • An introduction to frontend frameworks using Preact.
  • Installing npm packages and bundling.
  • Promises and async functions.

P.S. Don't go JSON waterfalls..

item.title: „ÄêThe attack on the npm ecosystem continues„ÄëÂØπ npm ÁîüÊÄÅÁ≥ªÁªüÁöÑÊîªÂáª‰ªçÂú®ÁªßÁª≠
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã753 ‚Äî September 19, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

The 'Shai-Hulud' npm Supply Chain Attack Rumbles On ‚Äî Now named after a term for the sandworms of the Dune universe, the ongoing malicious supply chain attack affecting the npm ecosystem has grown in scale with hundreds of packages affected in an attempt to exfiltrate tokens and secrets from developers‚Äô machines.

Pandya, van der Zee, and Brown (Socket)

The story above has triggered a wave of responses and mitigations:

  • pnpm 10.16 has been released with support for delaying dependency updates using a minimumReleaseAge option ‚Äì explained in more depth here. We expect to see more tools adopt similar features in due¬†course.

  • In 'a meditation on npm supply chain attacks', Tane Piper points a finger at Microsoft's¬†role.

  • Drew DeVault talks about a better future for JavaScript 'that won't happen', focusing on the systemic changes needed to improve the¬†situation.

FlexGrid by Wijmo: The Industry-Leading JavaScript Datagrid ‚Äî A fast and flexible DataGrid for building modern web apps. Key features and virtualized rendering are included in the core grid module. Pick & choose special features to keep your app small. Built for JavaScript, extended to Angular, React, and¬†Vue.

Wijmo From MESCIUS sponsor

‚öñÔ∏è¬†Deno Asks: 'Help Us Raise $200k to Free JavaScript from Oracle' ‚Äî The term JavaScript(‚Ñ¢) is actually an Oracle trademark, but Ryan Dahl and Deno are attempting to fight that and are raising funds to get through the all-important discovery phase of the cancellation¬†petition.

Ryan Dahl (Deno)

IN BRIEF:

  • The WebAssembly 3.0 standard is now 'live' (and already ships with most browsers) with various features that should improve JS interoperability, including garbage collection, tail calls, exception handling, and ways to manipulate JavaScript strings¬†directly.

  • ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Vue's Evan You was recently interviewed by Nuno Maduro of the Laravel project about his background at Google, how Vue.js was first created, the relationship between Next.js and Nuxt, and his current work with void(0).

  • We recently mentioned Andromeda as being the newest JavaScript runtime to appear, but now there's Ion, a runtime aimed at bringing a JavaScript engine into Rust programs.

  • Webflow has donated $150k to the Astro project.

RELEASES:

  • Safari 26.0 has been released alongside macOS 26.0, iOS 26.0, etc. Along with numerous CSS enhancements and a new <model> element for embedding 3D models onto web pages, every site can now "be a web app" on iOS and iPadOS if a user adds it to their home screen.

  • Bun v1.2.22 ‚Äì Stack traces now include asynchronous call frames, there's Bun.YAML.stringify to turn objects into YAML, bundler & minifier improvements, and¬†more.

  • As of React Router 7.9.0, the long-awaited middleware feature is now stable.

üìñ¬† Articles

Fetch Streams are Great, But Not for Measuring Upload/Download Progress ‚Äî Fetch upload streams seem well-suited for tracking the progress of uploads, but as Jake notes ‚Äújust because stuff is taken from the stream doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs yet been sent over the network‚Äù. He also touches on an issue relating to measuring download progress using response¬†streams.

Jake Archibald

Moving Off of TypeScript (We Love You, TypeScript) ‚Äî An interesting tale from an engineering team that has decided to throw in the towel on its 2.5 million lines of TypeScript, instead migrating to .NET and C#. React will remain on their frontend, however.

Chander Ramesh

Secure Your Agentic Apps with Auth for GenAI ‚Äî Secure your agentic apps with features like User Authentication for AI agents, Token Vault, and more with Auth0‚Äôs Auth for GenAI (exclusively in Developer¬†Preview).

Auth0 sponsor

'React Won by Default ‚Äì And It's Killing Frontend Innovation' ‚Äî An opinionated React thought-piece that‚Äôs provoked much discussion this week by poking at the downsides and inertia caused by ‚Äòthe React-by-default mindset.‚Äô

Loren Stewart

üìÑ Beyond The Horizon: How Angular is Embracing AI for Next-Gen Apps ‚Äì An update direct from the Angular¬†team. Simona Cotin (Angular)

üìÑ Solid.js vs. React: A Developer's Perspective ‚Äì ‚ÄúSolid has been a breath of fresh air and it has opened my eyes to what React could be, but probably never will¬†be.‚Äù Alem Tuzlak

üìÑ Creating an Immersive 3D Weather Visualization with React Three Fiber Carter Rink

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

npm-check-updates 18.2: Update package.json Dependencies to Latest Versions ‚Äî That is, as opposed to the specified versions. Includes a handy -i interactive mode so you can look at potential upgrades and then opt in to them one by one. v18.2 adds a ‚Äòcooldown‚Äô feature to help protect against supply chain attacks by requiring package versions to be published at least the given number of days before considering them for¬†upgrade.

Raine Revere

Expo SDK 54 Released: A Big One for React Native Developers ‚Äî The Expo framework continues its rapid ascent in the world of React Native with precompiled React Native iOS builds (for much shorter build times), iOS 26 and Liquid Glass support, and the use of React Native 0.81 and React 19.1. The new Expo File System has also become¬†stable.

Hughes and Vatne (Expo)

Ready to Increase Your Conversions? Get Started with Free Trials ‚Äî Free Trials are now available through Clerk Billing. Stop building trial logic, cancellation flows, and upgrade¬†paths.

Clerk sponsor

ü¶ã¬†BlueSky Likes: Flexible Components for Displaying Bluesky¬†Likes ‚Äî Includes two custom element components: bluesky-likes and bluesky-likers to display the number of likes and a group of avatars of those who liked a post respectively. Live¬†demo.

Lea Verou

Svedit: A Tiny Library for Building Rich Content Editors with Svelte ‚Äî Enables you to model your content in JSON, render it with custom Svelte components, and edit directly in the layout. GitHub¬†repo.

Michael Aufreiter

  • TypeBox 1.0 ‚Äì A runtime type system that creates in-memory JSON Schema objects that infer as TypeScript¬†types.

  • üôÇ Vue Frimousse v0.1.3 ‚Äì Unstyled, composable emoji picker for¬†Vue.

  • wait-on 9.0 ‚Äì CLI utility and Node API to wait for files, ports, sockets, and http(s) resources to become¬†available.

  • üóìÔ∏è DayPicker 9.10 ‚Äì React component for creating date pickers, calendars, and date¬†inputs.

  • Wasp 0.18 ‚Äì Wasp is a Rails-like framework using Node, React &¬†Prisma.

  • pretty-ms 9.3 ‚Äì Convert milliseconds to a human readable¬†string.

  • npm-publish 4.0 ‚Äì GitHub Action to publish packages to¬†npm.

  • Hexo 8.0 ‚Äì Popular blog framework/¬†generator.

  • Fresh 2.1 ‚Äì Deno-powered Web¬†framework.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

Go beyond caching. Redis 8.2 handles 5x more data with 150 new commands and 8 new data structures vs 7.2. Get started¬†today.

‚≠ê JetBrains JavaScript Day 2025 brings insights from experts like Ryan Carniato, Kent C. Dodds, and more. Free & online ‚Äì tune in on Oct¬†2!

üéÅ¬†Some Bonus Items

  • IINA is a popular, open-source media player for macOS and it has just added a JavaScript-based plugin system to let users extend its¬†functionality.

  • Which npm Package Has the Largest Version Number? Armed with Bun and access to the npm registry's data, a developer set out to satisfy his curiosity, discovering a variety of winners (depending on how you define ‚Äòversion‚Äô and¬†‚Äòlargest‚Äô).

  • üìÇ Want to download MDN for offline reference? The creator of the Dash macOS documentation browser shares some archive files of MDN's documentation covering areas like JavaScript, CSS, HTML and¬†SVG.

  • Bocoup's Mike Pennisi talks about the Web's most tolerated feature (yet an oft-forgotten one), namely the zoom CSS property.

item.title: „ÄêPackage efficiency and dependency hygiene„ÄëÂåÖÊïàÁéáÂíå‰æùËµñÂç´Áîü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã752 ‚Äî September 12, 2025

Read on the Web

If you have any interest in music and being able to render music or generate music with JavaScript, be sure to check out the very end of this issue where we've dedicated an entire section to the topic¬†:-)
__
Your editor, Peter Cooper

JavaScript Weekly

How to Keep package.json Under Control ‚Äî Staring at a 863 megabyte node_modules folder for Val Town‚Äôs React app, Tom got to thinking about ‚Äòdependency hygiene‚Äô and some good ways to keep things under control. Good tips and tool recommendations¬†here.

Tom MacWright

Behind the Scenes of bun install ‚Äî Talk about an epic post. This is no mere explanation of how Bun quickly and efficiently installs packages ‚Äî but a tour of package installation more generally, the underlying technicalities that make package installation tricky universally, and how Bun has tackled the¬†problem.

Lydia Hallie (Bun)

Stop Reinventing Forms. Use SurveyJS Instead ‚Äî SurveyJS UI components let you build JSON-driven forms, render them in React, Angular, Vue 3, or plain JS, and store results in your own DB. Open-source, extensible, no vendor lock-in ‚Äî save months of development and stay in control of your¬†data.

SurveyJS sponsor

A Major Supply Chain Attack Hit the npm Ecosystem ‚Äî Socket warned us about a phishing campaign targeting npm package publishers which, sadly, bore fruit earlier this week when a variety of popular packages became compromised (like Chalk, DuckDB's distribution for Node.js, debug, and many others).

Gooding, Brown, et al. (Socket)

RELEASES:

  • Deno 2.5 ‚Äì You can now create sets of permissions in deno.json, Deno.test gets some DX improvements, and deno bundle gets a programmatic API so you can script the bundling of your app, along with much more.

  • ESLint v9.35.0 ‚Äì Has a new rule (preserve-caught-error) for disallowing the loss of an originally caught error when re-throwing custom errors.

  • Node.js v24.8.0 (Current) ‚Äì Now supporting inspection of HTTP/2 network calls in Chrome¬†DevTools.

  • Electron 38 ‚Äì Mentioned last week, but now has an official blog post.

  • Storybook 10 is now in beta. The big change is it's going ESM only.

  • Ember 6.7, Rspack 1.5.3, Expo Router v6, Fastify 5.6

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

The Missing Link in JavaScript Tools? ‚Äî Marvin ponders whether today‚Äôs fractured toolchain for templates, CSS imports, JSX, and numerous other non-standard enhancements to JavaScript could be unified into a single¬†pipeline.

Marvin Hagemeister

Finally, Safe Array Methods in JavaScript ‚Äî arr.sort() will sort your array in place, whereas ES2023‚Äôs arr.toSorted() will return a new, sorted copy of arr. There are several such methods you might prefer to¬†use.

Matt Smith

Secure Your Agentic Apps with Auth for GenAI ‚Äî Secure your agentic apps with features like User Authentication for AI agents, Token Vault, and more with Auth0‚Äôs Auth for GenAI (exclusively in Developer¬†Preview).

Auth0 sponsor

An Interactive Guide to TanStack DB ‚Äî TanStack‚ÄØDB offers an embedded client‚Äëside database that uses differential dataflow to power live, relational queries, sub‚Äëms incremental updates, and optimistic writes. This tutorial leans on using it with React, but TanStack DB works alongside Vue, Solid, and Svelte as well.

Maxi Ferreira

üì∫ Handling 500 Million Clicks with a $4 VPS ‚Äì Behind the scenes of a Node-backed site that went¬†viral. Andrew Schmelyun

üìÑ How To Set Up Express.js 5 For Production in 2025 Jan Hesters

üìÑ Building Microfrontends with Module Federation and Vue Alex Opalic

üìÑ How Shopify Migrated to React Native's New Architecture Thiago Magalhaes (Shopify)

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Andromeda: The Newest JavaScript Runtime on the Block ‚Äî A new JavaScript and TypeScript runtime built around the Rust-powered Nova engine. It‚Äôs still early days but they‚Äôre promising a lot: native single file compilation, a GPU-accelerated 2D Canvas API, low runtime overhead, interop with Rust, memory safety, WinterTC compatibility, and cross-platform¬†support.

Andromeda Team

BlazeDiff: 'Blazing-Fast' Pixel-by-Pixel Image Comparisons ‚Äî The creator was happy with the established pixelmatch library for doing image comparisons, until it got too slow for the scale he wanted. Here‚Äôs the story of how he came up with a faster¬†alternative.

Teimur Gasanov

Unlock the Power of MCP Servers ‚Äî Clerk shows how MCP servers let AI apps access data securely with OAuth ‚Äî complete with a Next.js¬†demo.

Clerk sponsor

Feedsmith 2.0: Feed Parser and Generation Library ‚Äî As well as parsing feeds, you can also create RSS, Atom, JSON Feed, and OPML files with many common namespaces (iTunes, Podcast, Media RSS, Dublin Core, etc.) There‚Äôs a quick start tutorial for using it both in browsers or Node.js. GitHub¬†repo.

Maciej Lamberski

While we're on the topic, here are some other neat music related JavaScript projects we've enjoyed over the years:

  • alphaTab ‚Äì A full on music notation and guitar tab rendering library for building complete musical apps (above).

  • chiptune3.js ‚Äì A bit like SpressaSynth (also above) but for playing module file music. Live demo.

  • Tone.js ‚Äì An easy way to use the Web Audio API to create music in the browser. Someone used it to recreate the famous THX 'deep note' sound.

  • üé∏ SVGuitar ‚Äì A library to render SVG guitar chord charts.

  • JZZ.js ‚Äì A JavaScript MIDI library that hides a lot of complexity behind its chained syntax when you need to work directly with MIDI. (The keyboard logo at the top left of its homepage is a neat easter¬†egg.)

  • Strudel ‚Äì A live-coding environment in the browser for generating pieces of music with simple, chained JavaScript expressions.
